description: Borrowed from Latin colostrum, of uncertain origin.

entries.meaning: (medicine) A form of milk produced by the mammary glands in late pregnancy and the few days after giving birth. Human and bovine colostrum is thick and yellowish. In humans, it has high concentrations of nutrients and antibodies, but it is small in quantity.
examples: Synonyms: beestings, first milk, fore-milk, green milk

entries.meaning: A mixture of turpentine and egg yolk, formerly used as an emulsion.
